meanings.definition: A person who assumes a particular attitude or pose, especially in a self-conscious or artificial manner.
meanings.sent1: The group of posturers in the yoga class always tried to outdo each other with their poses.
meanings.sent2: The posturers at the fashion show struck elegant poses on the runway.
meanings.sent3: The posturers at the party were like living statues, frozen in exaggerated poses.
meanings.sent4: The posturers in the painting seemed to come to life, their poses full of drama and emotion.
meanings.sent5: The ballet posturers gracefully moved from one pose to another, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: To assume a particular attitude or pose, especially in a self-conscious or artificial manner.
meanings.sent1: She posturers in front of the mirror, practicing her confident pose for the interview.
meanings.sent2: The model posturers on the catwalk, showcasing the latest fashion trends.
meanings.sent3: He posturers awkwardly in an attempt to impress his crush with a cool pose.
meanings.sent4: The politician posturers during the speech, trying to appear sincere to the audience.
meanings.sent5: The actor posturers on stage, embodying the character with each pose and gesture.
